messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] fed-up...Tracy
messages.msgSnippet: AMEN!! Amy. I have an only she is 9 and yes I spend 99.9% of my time trying to entertain her , she can be very lonely.
messages.messageBody:
AMEN!! Amy.
I have an only she is 9 and yes I spend 99.9% of my time trying to entertain
her , she can be very lonely.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] fed-up...Tracy
messages.msgSnippet: I was an only and I have friends that have onlys and it s far more demanding than you think. You are the main source of entertainment for the child. I remember
messages.messageBody:
I was an only and I have friends that have onlys and it's far more demanding
than you think. You are the main source of entertainment for the child. I
remember when my second became old enough to interact with my first. I felt
like a new person. They we're playing with each other and I didn't
constantly have to be entertaining her. I know moms of onlys that spend all
their time on the phone planning their kid's days. At least those of us with
more than one know that they'll always have someone to play with.
amy

too!!
>
> Cathie (mom of 5)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] fed-up...Tracy
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/19/00 8:05:17 PM Eastern Daylight Time, tracy.oldfield@ntlworld.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/19/00 8:05:17 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
tracy.oldfield@... writes:

<< Julie, is she an only? i sometimes think it's tons easier to
organise to do this kind of thing with an only. >>
No, She is three and I have a 14month old son. You are right it was much
easier with just one! Two is very exhausting trying to keep up or catch up
whichever the case my be....

Julie
